meanings.definition: To become awake or alert in the morning.
meanings.sent1: She bethornings slowly every day, taking her time to wake up.
meanings.sent2: I bethorning with a stretch and a yawn before getting out of bed.
meanings.sent3: The alarm clock bethornings her abruptly, making her jump out of bed.
meanings.sent4: The sun's rays bethorning the earth, bringing light to a new day.
meanings.sent5: The chirping birds bethorning the forest, signaling the start of morning.

meanings.definition: To awaken or rouse from sleep in the morning.
meanings.sent1: He gently bethornings his sister, whispering 'Good morning' in her ear.
meanings.sent2: The smell of pancakes bethornings the whole family on weekends.
meanings.sent3: The loud noise from the construction site bethornings the entire neighborhood.
meanings.sent4: The aroma of fresh coffee bethornings the senses, enticing everyone to wake up.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the rooster bethornings the farm, signaling the start of a new day.
